profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-03 13:21:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collections contains records on the founding of the SUNY Albany Chapter of Sigma Xi and its early years.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Sigma Xi is an academic honor society, originally founded at Cornell University in 1886. The Albany chapter of the Society was founded as a club in 1943; the club became a fully affiliated chapter with the national Sigma Xi organization in 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is made up of a formal petition for establishment of the chapter, copies of posters and articles on the chapter's establishment and correspondence files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was maintained in the original order after it was transferred.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestrcited

The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Sigma Xi Records, 1968-1976. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Sigma Xi Records).
